elements.name: spouseName
elements.title: What is the full name of {deceasedName}'s spouse?
elements.description:
Use the name as it appears on their primary identification (if you can get it).

This name should be written using the Roman alphabet. English and French are examples of languages that use the Roman alphabet.

elements.name: spouseIsAliveFAQ1
elements.title: What if {spouseName} is on life support?

elements.name: spouseIsAdultNoExplanation
elements.title:
Because {spouseName} is under the age of 19, {spouseName}'s parent or guardian needs to know that you are applying for a `Representation Grant`.

The Public Guardian and Trustee (PGT) of British Columbia also needs to know that you are applying for a Representation Grant. This service will tell you how to let them know in a later step.

For now, please continue answering questions about {spouseName}.

elements.title: What if {spouseName} is homeless?
elements.body:
If {spouseName} was homeless,
  • Write "no fixed address" for the street number and street name.
  • Write the City/Town, Province, and Country where they lived.
  • Write "n/a" for their Postal Code.

elements.name: spouseHasNominee
elements.title: Is there someone who helps {spouseName} manage their money and legal decisions?
elements.description: This person would be considered {spouseName}'s `Nominee`. If {spouseName}'s Nominee is not alive anymore, select "NO".

elements.name: spouseHasNomineeNoExplanation
elements.title:
Because {spouseName} is not `mentally competent`, but they do not have a `nominee`, you need to let {spouseName} know directly that you are applying for a `Representation Grant`.

This service will tell you how to let them know in a later step.

elements.name: spouseNomineeName
elements.title: What is the name of the person who helps {spouseName} manage their money and legal decisions?
elements.description: This name should be written using the Roman alphabet. English and French are examples of languages that use the Roman alphabet.

elements.name: spouseNomineeFormal
elements.title: Was {spouseNomineeName} formally appointed to help {spouseName} manage their money and legal decisions?
elements.description:
These are the ways someone can be formally appointed.
  • {spouseName} could have signed a document that gave someone else the power of attorney using the Power of Attorney Act,
  • {spouseName} could have signed a document that appointed someone as a representative using the Representation Agreement Act, or
  • a person can be appointed by the Court using the Patients Property Act,
  • a person could have been appointed either the Minister of Aboriginal Affairs and Northern Development or by the Court using the Indian Act

elements.name: spouseNomineeFormalYesExplanation
elements.title:
The Public Guardian and Trustee (PGT) will need a copy of the legal document that proves that {spouseNomineeName} was formally appointed as {spouseName}'s `nominee`.

You can get a head start by asking {spouseNomineeName} for that document now, or, you can wait for this service to remind you in a later step.

For now, please continue answering questions about {spouseNomineeName}.

elements.name: spouseNomineeFormalNoExplanation
elements.title:
Even if {spouseNomineeName} was not formally appointed to help {spouseName}, it is still best to let both {spouseNomineeName} and {spouseName} know that you are applying for a `Representation Grant`.

This service will tell you how to let them know in a later step.

For now, please continue answering questions about {spouseNomineeName}.

elements.name: spouseDiedAfterFAQ1
elements.title: Why does this date matter?
elements.body:
Under the law, in order for {spouseName} to qualify for {deceasedName}'s `assets`, {spouseName} must have lived for at least 5 days after {deceasedName} died. Once {spouseName} has qualified, it doesn't matter if {spouseName} is now dead.

The people managing {spouseName}'s belongings need to know that you are applying for a `Representation Grant` for {deceasedName}.

For more information, click here for the Five-day survival rule from the Wills, Estate and Succession Act (WESA). (This link opens in a new tab)

elements.name: spouseDiedAfterNoExplanation
elements.title: Because {spouseName} died before {deceasedDateOfDeathPlus4}, the people managing {spouseName}'s belongings do not need to know that you are applying for a `Representation Grant` for {deceasedName}.

elements.name: spouseDiedAfterYesExplanation
elements.title:
Because {spouseName} has died after {deceasedDateOfDeathPlus4}, {spouseName}'s `personal representative` needs to know that you are applying for a `Representation Grant` for {deceasedName}.

It is your responsibility to check with {spouseName}'s family and friends to find out who is {spouseName}'s personal representative.

If you find out that {spouseName} does not have a personal representative, this service will help you tell that to The Court.

elements.name: spouseHasPersonalRep
elements.title: Do you know if {spouseName} has a `personal representative`?
elements.description:
If {spouseName}'s personal representative is not alive anymore, contact that person's personal representative to find out who is now representing {spouseName}.

If someone is planning on becoming {spouseName}'s personal representative but hasn't done so yet, it is safer for you to include them as {spousePersonName}'s personal representative.

choices.text: I know {spouseName} does NOT have a personal representative
I don't know if {spouseName} has a personal representative

elements.name: spousePersonalRepName
elements.title: What is the name of {spouseName}'s `personal representative`
elements.description: This name should be written using the Roman alphabet. English and French are examples of languages that use the Roman alphabet.

elements.name: spouseHasPersonalRepYesExplanation
elements.title:
Because {spouseName} died after {deceasedDateOfDeathPlus4}, {spousePersonalRepName} needs to know that you are applying for a `Representation Grant` for {deceasedName}.

This service will tell you how to let them know in a later step.

elements.name: spouseHasPersonalRepNoTempError
elements.title: For now, this service has only been developed for a limited number of situations. At this time, this service cannot help you apply for a Representation Grant.

elements.name: spouseHasPersonalRepDKError
elements.title:
Because you are not sure if {spouseName} has a personal representative, you may want to check with as many of {spouseName}'s family and friends as you can find.

If {spouseName}'s family or friends do not know if {spouseName} has a personal representative, one option may be hiring a professional investigator to try and find out for sure.

Examples of professional investigators include private investigators, heir tracers and other similar services.

For transparency of your application, you want to show the court all efforts made to find out whether {spouseName} has a personal representative. The Court will ultimately decide whether sufficient effort has been made to find this information.
